description: I found out that with any other Linux compatible PDF reader will NOT WORK and NOT open a PDF file. But with this WILL OPEN a file. Seems, something special PDF file are supported ONLY by Adobe Reader. And this is reason why we need on Linux.
summary: Required reader that only works with Adobe Reader

description: This version of Adobe reader looks like very old, and it crashes when I try to open the government documents. I suggerst the Snap that works much better and is newer

Flatpak is such a wonderful technology because we can use it to preserve apps that are no longer supported by the original authors. I have been waiting for this for so long. Love it, love it , love it. Don't forget to use flatseal if you want this to be able to access other locations.
summary: Finally. Adobe Reader as a flatpak

description: Awesome, Finally Adobe Reader in store. One click install
Unofficial, unmaintained and proprietary. But works

It is much smaller than the current Windows Acrobat reader (60MB vs 0.5GB).

Would recommend the Firefox build-in pdf.js instead (if you need to fill-in a form).

Irrationally and emotionally blind adobe lovers: NOTE: This software is unmaintained by the vendor and may contain security vulnerabilities.
NOTE: This wrapper is not verified by, affiliated with, or supported by Adobe. 
Fact: Adobe proprietary software is loaded with security vulnerabilities and backdoors and data breaches. Oh but that was a long time ago you say? Not so fast. The latest data breach and vulnerability was a few weeks ago in October 2023 according to CISA. The breaches and vulnerabilities are relentless, continuously ongoing and never ending.
no puedo tocar nada se tilda no sirve
summary: muy mala no se puede hacer nada
